intro: Stillingia guineensis, commonly known as African stellaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Stillingia guineensis is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
